intro: Myosotis scorpioides subsp. rivularis, commonly known as the water forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist or aquatic habitats, such as stream banks and wet meadows. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, facilitating its spread in suitable environments.
